Key Match Events: Aiden Markram held a superb running effort from over his shoulder off the first ball of the final over, effectively sealing the win for South Africa.
Harry Brook hit a defiant half-century, but fell to Kagiso Rabada when trying to hit into the wind.
Quinton de Kock hit a crucial knock of 65, helping South Africa score 163 for six in the powerplay.
Sam Curran could hit only one boundary thereafter, as South Africa held their nerve in the denouement.
Pre-Game Insights: Jos Buttler’s defending champions can still progress to the semi-finals provided they beat USA in Barbados earlier that day.
Keshav Maharaj removed two dangerous hitters in Buttler and Jonny Bairstow.
David Miller’s 43 burnished South Africa’s 163 for six.
Post-Match Reflections: England’s captain Jos Buttler cited South Africa’s strong powerplay bowling as the key to their victory, saying, 'De Kock came out with a lot of intensity and we couldn’t quite match that.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Reeza Hendricks laboured to 19 from 25 balls before holing out off Moeen Ali in the 10th over.
Archer’s first over cost 21 runs, but he later shut down Quinton de Kock’s buttery knock with a sumptuous pick-up-and-throw to run out Heinrich Klaasen.
